articles.title: Being fully vaccinated halves risk of getting long Covid after infection, UK study suggests - Business Insider South Africa
articles.description: Full vaccination halved this risk by 47%, though partial vaccination was not as effective at this, said the study published in The Lancet.
articles.content:
Being fully vaccinated halves the risk of developing long-lasting symptoms from a Covid-19 infection, also known as "long Covid," according to a large UK study.
